com.kk.inject

Class Factory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.kk.inject.Factory

  • public class Factory
extends java.lang.Object
    Factory for the dependency injection.

    • Method Summary

      Adds the module class to the definition list of the factory class.

      Retrieves the singleton factory instance.

      Performs the injection on the object created other way than getInstance(Class, Object...).

    • Method Detail

      • addModuleClass

        public static void addModuleClass(java.lang.Class<? extends Module> moduleClass)
        Adds the module class to the definition list of the factory class.
        Parameters:
        moduleClass - The class of the module to register. Never null.

      • createFactory

        public static Factory createFactory()
        Creates the factory as defined by the methods above.
        Returns:
        The factory. Never null.

      • get

        public <T> T get(java.lang.Class<T> clazz,
        java.lang.Object... parameters)
        Ensures the instance of the specified class using the registered modules.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The class type to ensure the type safety by the compiler.
        Parameters:
        clazz - The class to instantiate. Never null.
        parameters - The optional parameters to be passed to the newly created instance. Can be missing.
        Returns:
        The ensured instance. Never null.
        Throws:
        InjectException - When there is a problem with the instance ensuring. It is a runtime exception as such a problem mostly signals the clear programming error (like missing suitable constructor).

      • getInstance

        public static <T> T getInstance(java.lang.Class<T> clazz,
                java.lang.Object... parameters)
        Ensures the instance of the specified class using the registered modules.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The class type to ensure the type safety by the compiler.
        Parameters:
        clazz - The class to instantiate. Never null.
        parameters - The optional parameters to be passed to the newly created instance. Can be missing.
        Returns:
        The ensured instance. Never null.
        Throws:
        InjectException - When there is a problem with the instance ensuring. It is a runtime exception as such a problem mostly signals the clear programming error (like missing suitable constructor).

      • getSingleton

        Retrieves the singleton factory instance.
        Returns:

      • inject

        public <T> T inject(T objectToInject)
        Performs the injection on the object created other way than getInstance(Class, Object...).
        Type Parameters:
        T - The class type to ensure the type safety by the compiler.
        Parameters:
        objectToInject - The object to perform the injection on. Never null.
        Returns:
        The object with injection performed. Never null.
        Throws:
        InjectException - When there is a problem with the instance ensuring. It is a runtime exception as such a problem mostly signals the clear programming error (like missing suitable constructor).
